name: Avoid using signals management Functions
description: This rule searches for C/C++ functions that call signal management functions like "signal" or "raise".
output:
Associated to each C/C++ function with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- Number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code:
  - signal management function call
rationale:
Failing to properly handle various signals would likely cause your application to terminate, when it receives such signals.
In addition, the use of signal management functions slows down the application.
remediation:
Avoid signal management when possible.
Secure signal management with proper signal masking (use of "sigaction()")
